[vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” css=”.vc_custom_1476255884282{margin-top: -33px !important;margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-bottom: 0px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}”][vc_column width=”1/2″ css=”.vc_custom_1462531430496{padding-top: 0px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1476350598017{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}”]

ABOUT CLUB

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1476256026301{margin-bottom: 23px !important;}”]American football, referred to as football in the United States and Canada, and also known as gridiron, is a sport played by two teams of eleven players on a rectangular field with goalposts at each end. The offense, the team with control of the oval-shaped football, attempts to advance down the field by running with or passing the ball, while the team without control of the ball, the defense, aims to stop their advance and take control of the ball for themselves.

The offense must advance at least ten yards in four downs, or plays, or else they turn over the football to the opposing team; if they succeed, they are given a new set of four downs. The team with the most points at the end of a game wins.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_single_image image=”1777″ img_size=”full” onclick=”link_image” css_animation=”right-to-left” css=”.vc_custom_1482934349059{margin-top: 48px !important;margin-bottom: 36px !important;}”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=”.vc_custom_1476351365285{padding-bottom: 79px !important;}”][vc_column width=”2/3″ css=”.vc_custom_1476350633477{padding-top: 0px !important;padding-bottom: 0px !important;}”][stm_coach_excerption title=”Coach`s Welcome” name=”James O. Spiceman” excerption=”Before you can build an effective team, you need high-performing players. So next time you consider hiring a new employee, revisit these 4 characteristics. If you have an open floor plan, you may not want to hire someone who is extremely introverted or accustomed to working remotely.” photo=”1786″ signature=”1288″][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/3″ el_class=”stm-gray-bg” css=”.vc_custom_1476350657725{padding-top: 0px !important;padding-bottom: 0px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1476351293130{margin-bottom: 21px !important;}”]

Officials and fouls

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1476262895964{margin-bottom: 12px !important;}”]The seven officials on the field are each tasked with a different set of responsibilities:[/vc_column_text][stm_icon_list]

  • The referee is positioned behind and to the side of the offensive backs.
  • The umpire is positioned in the defensive backfield, except in the NFL

[/stm_icon_list][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row_content_no_spaces” css=”.vc_custom_1514885037583{padding-bottom: 10px !important;background: #fafaf8 url(https://splash.stylemixthemes.com/football/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2016/04/testimonials_banner.jpg?id=1266) !important;}”][vc_column][stm_reviews_carousel title=”What fans are saying” review_view_style=”review_style_two”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” css=”.vc_custom_1482328801300{padding-top: 10px !important;padding-bottom: 48px !important;background-color: #f0f0f0 !important;}”][vc_column][stm_trophies][stm_trophy images=”1048,1048,1048,1048″ image=”1304″ year=”2015″ title=”Senior World Championship”][stm_trophy images=”1048,1048,1048,1048″ image=”1305″ year=”2012″ title=”U-19 World Championship”][stm_trophy images=”1048,1048,1048,1048″ image=”1306″ year=”2013″ title=”Flag World Championship”][stm_trophy images=”1048,1048,1048,1048″ image=”1305″ year=”2012″ title=”International Bowl”][/stm_trophies][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” css=”.vc_custom_1476269661562{padding-top: 28px !important;padding-bottom: 59px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}”][vc_column][stm_carousel image_size=”full” disable_controlls=”disable” images=”1320,1316,1314,1313,1312″][/vc_column][/vc_row]
